vatRateResults.comment: The Standard Rate of VAT was temporarily reduced from 23% to 21% from 1 September 2020 to 28 February 2021. It has been restored to 23% from 1 March 2021.

code.description: Meat of bovine animals, fresh or chilled
Fish fillets and other fish meat (whether or not minced), fresh, chilled or frozen
Milk and cream, not concentrated nor containing added sugar or other sweetening matter
CHAPTER 7 - EDIBLE VEGETABLES AND CERTAIN ROOTS AND TUBERS
Citrus fruit, fresh or dried

Bread, pastry, cakes, biscuits and other bakers' wares, whether or not containing cocoa; communion wafers, empty cachets of a kind suitable for pharmaceutical use, sealing wafers, rice paper and similar products

category.description: Foodstuffs (including beverages but excluding alcoholic beverages) for human and animal consumption; live animals, seeds, plants and ingredients normally intended for use in the preparation of foodstuffs; products normally used to supplement foodstuffs or as a substitute for foodstuffs

vatRateResults.comment: The Zero Rate of VAT applies to the supply of foodstuffs like bread, butter, cheese, cereals, condiments, flour, fruit, herbs, meat, milk, pasta, pastes, sauces, soups, spices, sugar and vegetables, (fresh or frozen). This is not an exhaustive list, but an indicative one. When supplied in the course of catering or from a vending machine, these foods become liable to the reduced rate. Certain other foods are Standard Rated.

code.description: Bread, pastry, cakes, biscuits and other bakers' wares, whether or not containing cocoa; communion wafers, empty cachets of a kind suitable for pharmaceutical use, sealing wafers, rice paper and similar products
Gingerbread and the like
Other
Food preparations not elsewhere specified or included

category.description: Foodstuffs (including beverages but excluding alcoholic beverages) for human and animal consumption; live animals, seeds, plants and ingredients normally intended for use in the preparation of foodstuffs; products normally used to supplement foodstuffs or as a substitute for foodstuffs

vatRateResults.comment: The supply of bakery products, such as cakes, certain biscuits, bagels and croissants, (being flour or egg based) is liable to VAT at the reduced rate  . This applies when the products are served with meals or supplied as a cold take-away. The supply of bread that meets the ingredient definition in Irish VAT legislation is liable to the zero rate. Food Supplement Products are also subject to the reduced rate.

code.description: Vegetable materials and vegetable waste, vegetable residues and by-products, whether or not in the form of pellets, of a kind used in animal feeding, not elsewhere specified or included

category.description: Foodstuffs (including beverages but excluding alcoholic beverages) for human and animal consumption; live animals, seeds, plants and ingredients normally intended for use in the preparation of foodstuffs; products normally used to supplement foodstuffs or as a substitute for foodstuffs

vatRateResults.comment: Animal feeding stuffs, (other than that which is packaged, sold, or otherwise for dogs, cats, cage birds or domestic pets, which is Standard-rated)

code.description: CHAPTER 30 - PHARMACEUTICAL PRODUCTS
Chemical contraceptive preparations based on hormones, on other products of heading 2937 or on spermicides
Sanitary towels (pads), tampons and similar articles

category.description: Pharmaceutical products used for medical and veterinary purposes, including products used for contraception and female sanitary protection, and absorbent hygiene products

vatRateResults.comment: Human Oral Medicine, Oral and Non-oral hormone replacement therapy, Oral and Non-oral Nicotine Replacement Therapy, Oral Contraception, and sanitary products are zero-rated for VAT purposes (e. Animal Oral medicine is also zero-rated (excluding medicine for dogs, cats, cage birds or domestic pets, which is standard rated. All non-oral animal medicines are also standard rated.)

code.description: Printed books, brochures, leaflets and similar printed matter, whether or not in single sheets
Children's picture, drawing or colouring books
Maps and hydrographic or similar charts of all kinds, including atlases, wall maps, topographical plans and globes, printed

category.description: Supply, including on loan by libraries, of books, newspapers and periodicals either on physical means of support or supplied electronically, or both, (including brochures, leaflets and similar printed matter, children's picture, drawing or colouring books, music printed or in manuscript form, maps and hydrographic or similar charts), other than publications wholly or predominantly devoted to advertising and other than publications wholly or predominantly consisting of video content or audible music; production of publications of non-profit-making organisations and services related to such production

vatRateResults.comment: The Zero Rate applies to newspapers, printed books, e-books, audiobooks, atlases, annual publications, childrenâ€™s picture, colouring and music books. For a printed booklet to qualify for the zero rating, it must consist of essentially pictorial or textual matter, must have a distinctive front cover devoid of body text, must be no less than eight pages (excluding the cover) and must be bound, stitched or stapled.

code.description: Carriages for disabled persons, whether or not motorised or otherwise mechanically propelled

Orthopaedic appliances, including crutches, surgical belts and trusses; splints and other fracture appliances; artificial parts of the body; hearing aids and other appliances which are worn or carried, or implanted in the body, to compensate for a defect or disability

category.description: Medical equipment, appliances, devices, items, aids and protective gear, including health protection masks, normally intended for use in health care or for the use of the disabled, goods essential to compensate and overcome disability, as well as the adaptation, repair, rental and leasing of such goods

vatRateResults.comment: Comments Certain Medical equipment, aids and their parts are at the 0% VAT rate. This includes, invalid carriages, orthopaedic appliances, surgical belts, artificial limbs, artificial parts of the body,  and deaf aids, walking frames, crutches, and parts of same. This does not include artificial teeth, corrective spectacles, or contact lenses. For specific queries, more detail can be found on the Revenue Commissioner's VAT Rates Database - https://www.revenue.ie/en/vat/vat-rates/index.aspx

vatRateResults.comment: Zero rate of VAT applies to the supply and installation of solar panels in private dwellings (from 1 May 2023); and to primary and secondary schools from 1 January 2024.

vatRateResults.comment: 9% applies to brochures, leaflets, programmes, catalogues, directories, maps, hydrographic and similar charts, and printed music- other than in book or booklet form; excluding matter devoted to advertising. The rate for these items was temporarily reduced from 13.5% to 9% from 1 November 2020 to 31 August 2023.

Non-oral contraceptive products are liable at the 13.5% rate, including condoms and contraceptive gels.
